intro: Echinospermum redowskii, commonly known as the redowskii echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Echinospermum redowskii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
